intro: Ceropegia tanzaniensis, commonly known as the Tanzanian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a trailing vine with fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often visited by specific insect pollinators. Ceropegia tanzaniensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
